steps.title: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen. If you're using an iPad running iOS 12 or later, this will display a list of currently-open apps. When your finger reaches the middle of the screen, pause your upward-swipe. [1] X Research source If you're using an older version of iOS, double-click the Home button at the bottom of the screen to show a list of recently-used apps.

steps.title: Locate the frozen app.
steps.content: Locate the frozen app. If the frozen app does not appear on this screen, swipe left or right until you see it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Swipe up on the frozen app.
steps.content: Swipe up on the frozen app. This should close the app.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button until the slider button displays on-screen.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button until the slider button displays on-screen. This button is usually on the top or side of the iPad. If the iPad is frozen but the home screen (or an app) is still visible, you may be able to use this method to restart it.

steps.title: Use your finger to slide the button to its “Off” position.
steps.content: Use your finger to slide the button to its “Off” position. Your iPad will shut down.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button to power on your iPad.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button to power on your iPad. If your iPad turns back on and works properly, you should be all set. If not, try doing a hard reset. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Try opening or closing an app on your iPad.
steps.content: Try opening or closing an app on your iPad. If the iPad's screen is black or otherwise unusable, use this method to perform a hard reset. Use this method if you have an 11” or 12.9” iPad Pro. This method also works for the iPhone X, XR, and other X models.

steps.title: Press and release the Volume-Up button.
steps.content: Press and release the Volume-Up button. As soon as you release your finger, move quickly to the next step. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Press and release the Volume-Down button.
steps.content: Press and release the Volume-Down button. Again, move quickly to the next step once you release your finger.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button until the iPad restarts.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button until the iPad restarts. This should reboot your iPad to a functional home screen. If your iPad does not come back up or is still unusable, try charging it for an hour.

steps.title: Try opening or closing an app on your iPad.
steps.content: Try opening or closing an app on your iPad. If the iPad's screen is black or otherwise unusable, use this method to perform a hard reset. Use this method for standard iPads and the iPad Mini.

steps.title: Press and hold the Home and the top (or side) buttons at the same time.
steps.content: Press and hold the Home and the top (or side) buttons at the same time. Continue holding these buttons for about 10 seconds.

steps.title: Release your fingers when the Apple logo appears.
steps.content: Release your fingers when the Apple logo appears. This should reboot your iPad to a functional home screen. If your iPad does not come back up or is still unusable, try charging it for an hour.

steps.title: Connect the iPad to a power source.
steps.content: Connect the iPad to a power source. If your iPad won't start up or turn on, it may need to be charged for an extended period of time. Use the cord that came with your iPad (or a compatible replacement) to connect your iPad to a wall charger, your computer, or another power source.

steps.title: Check for the lightning icon next to the battery indicator.
steps.content: Check for the lightning icon next to the battery indicator. If you are able to view the home screen, you should see a tiny lightning bolt at the top-right corner (to the right of the battery indicator). This means the iPad is charging. If you can see the home screen but the iPad is not charging, try connecting it to a different power source. If that doesn't work, try to use a different charging cable. If the iPad will not turn on, allow it to charge for approximately one hour. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on the iPad after one hour of charging.
steps.content: Turn on the iPad after one hour of charging. Press and hold the Power button on your iPad to turn it back on. If you are still not able to use the iPad, see How to Restore an iPad to learn how to restore your iPad to its original factory settings.
